title: Cladogram orangutan gorilla chimp bonobo human 5

content.question: Toxic substances often have a bitter taste that causes animals who try to eat such substances to spit them out rather than swallow them. Additional data suggest that gorilla populations have a very low frequency of nontasters. Which of the following best predicts the likely evolution of the TAS2R38 locus in the gorilla population?

choices.label: Gorillas who could taste bitter toxins were more likely to survive and reproduce than nontasters.
Gorillas who could taste bitter toxins became resistant to the toxins, so the taster gene was no longer under selective pressure.
Gorillas acquired the taster allele by horizontal gene transfer from chimpanzees.
Gorillas who could taste bitter toxins could utilize food resources that nontasters could not.

content.answer: Gorillas who could taste bitter toxins were more likely to survive and reproduce than nontasters.
